title: 3 Simple Ways to Cancel a Payment in the Apple App Store

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. It's the gray gear icon on your home screen or app library. [1] X Research source Canceling a subscription will prevent you from being charged in the future for that app or service. If you have an Apple TV and want to cancel a subscription before your payment is due, you can use this method. Just make sure you're signed in using the same Apple ID used to make the purchase.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID . This is at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Subscriptions.
steps.content: Tap Subscriptions . You can find this underneath Payment & Shipping . You'll see a list of all active and inactive subscriptions.

steps.title: Tap the subscription you want to cancel.
steps.content: Tap the subscription you want to cancel. Information about your current plan and next payment will appear. If you don't see the upcoming payment you're looking for, you may have purchased using a different Apple ID or by paying directly to the app or service in question. If you paid directly, log into the service's website to cancel it there.

steps.title: Tap Cancel Subscription.
steps.content: Tap Cancel Subscription . It's the red text near the bottom of the page. A confirmation message will appear. If you don't see a Cancel option, you have no upcoming payment and will not be charged again for this service.

steps.title: Tap Confirm.
steps.content: Tap Confirm . You will not be charged again for the selected app or service. You can continue using the app or service's features until the final date of your billing cycle, which appears at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Open the App Store.
steps.content: Open the App Store . It's the blue icon with a white "A" on the Dock.

steps.title: Click your name in the bottom-left corner.
steps.content: Click your name in the bottom-left corner. If you don't see your name, click the profile icon instead, and then log in with your Apple ID.

steps.title: Click Account Settings.
steps.content: Click Account Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Manage.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Manage . This will be under Subscriptions .

steps.title: Click Edit next to the subscription.
steps.content: Click Edit next to the subscription. You'll see information about your current plan and next payment.

steps.title: Click Cancel Subscription.
steps.content: Click Cancel Subscription . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . You will not be charged again for the selected app or service. You can continue using the app or service's features until the final date of your billing cycle, which appears at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. This is the multi-colored music note with a white background. iTunes is available to download on Windows 11, 10, 8, and 7.

steps.title: Click Account.
steps.content: Click Account . This is in the menu bar, next to Controls .

steps.title: Click View My Account.
steps.content: Click View My Account . A new window will open.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Manage.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Manage . This will be under Subscriptions .

steps.title: Click Edit next to the subscription.
steps.content: Click Edit next to the subscription. You'll see information about your current plan and next payment.

steps.title: Click Cancel Subscription.
steps.content: Click Cancel Subscription . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . You will not be charged again for the selected app or service. You can continue using the app or service's features until the final date of your billing cycle, which appears at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Go to https://reportaproblem.apple.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://reportaproblem.apple.com/ in a web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile browser. [2] X Research source Refunding a subscription will result in loss of subscription access. You can only refund a subscription if the charge goes through; if it's still pending, you won't be able to request a refund yet.

steps.title: Enter your Apple ID.
steps.content: Enter your Apple ID. Use the Apple ID associated with the subscription you want to refund.

steps.title: Enter your password.
steps.content: Enter your password. If you forgot your password, you can reset it . If you have two-factor authentication on, you'll be asked to approve your login on another device. Enter the code into the field.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu and select Request a refund.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu and select Request a refund . This is the menu underneath What can we help you with? A new field will appear with Tell us moreâ€¦ .

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu and select a reason.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu and select a reason. Choose the reason that fits your scenario. You can select: I didn't mean to buy this A child/minor made purchases(s) without permission I didn't mean to sign up for a subscription(s) I didn't intend to renew a subscription(s) My purchase doesn't work as expected In-app purchase not received Other

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . You'll see a list of current and past subscriptions.

steps.title: Select the subscription, then click Submit.
steps.content: Select the subscription, then click Submit . This is the blue button at the top. If you see Next instead of submit, click it. In the text field, explain your situation further. Click Submit . Apple will generally respond to your request within 48 hours via email. If your refund is approved, the funds will be applied to the account you used to make the payment. The funds may take several days to appear in your banking or credit card account. You can also cancel an iTunes subscription on PC or Mac or dispute iTunes charges.
